intro: Silene ocymoides, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink or red flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Silene ocymoides is known for its short lifespan, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
